pageTitle: Prime Minister Justin Trudeau speaks with Quebec Premier François Legault | Prime Minister of Canada
articleHtml:
Today, Prime Minister Justin Trudeau spoke with Quebec Premier François Legault to discuss the evolving COVID-19 situation.

Both leaders reaffirmed their commitment to continued collaboration and coordination between their respective governments in addressing COVID-19. They discussed the measures announced by the Government of Canada to support workers and businesses under Canada’s COVID-19 Economic Response Plan.

They also discussed preparations and actions undertaken by the federal government and its provincial and territorial partners to address the evolution of COVID-19. They agreed that it is critical for governments to work together in order to obtain essential data and information.

The Government of Canada is taking a whole-of-government, comprehensive, and coordinated approach to respond to COVID-19. The well-being and safety of Quebecers and all Canadians is the Government’s top priority.
